summary: Two bedroom, two bathroom lateral apartment on the second floor of the sought after Brewhouse Yard development. EPC rating B.
feesApplyText:
TENANT FEES / CHARGES & INFORMATION

HOUSING ACT TENANCIES (AST)

- Fee of Intent: Equivalent of 1 weeks  rent which is put towards your first rental payment and is your agreement to proceed with the agreed tenancy terms (subject to contract and references). This may be retained if you provide false or misleading information when submitting an offer that is subsequently accepted by the Landlord, or in the event you are unable to provide satisfactory  Right to Rent  checks.

- Deposit: If the annual rent is less than £50,000, this will be equivalent to 5 weeks  rent. If the annual rent is £50,000 or more, this is equivalent of 6 weeks  rent.

- Change of sharer: £41.67 + VAT one off charge to cover referencing and admin.

- Mid-term change: Up to £41.67 + VAT for any reasonable costs incurred.

- Early termination (at Landlord s discretion): All costs, fees and charges incurred by the Landlord for allowing early termination including the agent's existing or re-letting fees and the rent until such time as the tenancy is mutually terminated.

- Stamp Duty Land Tax: Payable once the cumulative rent exceeds £125,000.

- Overseas bank charges: £30 + VAT per transaction

- Interest on late or unpaid rental payments: These may be charged  at 3% above the Bank of England base rate per annum, calculated daily where rent is unpaid for 14 days or more.

- Lost keys: Full replacement costs are chargeable for keys, fobs or security devices which have been lost, damaged or broken. A £15 pr/hr charge for the time spent coordinating the replacement will also be payable.

NON-HOUSING ACT TENANCIES

- Fee of Intent: Equivalent of 1 weeks  rent which will be put towards your first rental payment, due at the start of the tenancy. 

- Tenancy paperwork: £200 + VAT one-off charge.

- Company reference checks: £120 + VAT one-off charge per tenant reference.

- Deposit: Equivalent to 6 weeks  rent. May be higher if you have pets or if specifically negotiated.

- Check in and/or Check out: £100 - £500 + VAT depending on property size. 

- Change of sharer: £200 + VAT one-off charge to cover referencing/administration.

- Mid-term change: Up to £200 + VAT for any reasonable costs incurred.

- Tenancy extension / renewal paperwork: £200 + VAT one-off charge.
                
- Early termination (at Landlord s discretion): All costs, fees and charges incurred by the Landlord for allowing early termination including the agent's existing or re-letting fees and the rent until such time as the tenancy is mutually terminated.

- Stamp Duty Land Tax: Payable once the cumulative rent exceeds £125,000.

- Overseas bank charges: £30 + VAT per transaction

- Interest on late or unpaid rental payments: These may be charged  at 3% above the Bank of England base rate per annum, calculated daily where rent is unpaid for 14 days or more.

- Lost keys: Full replacement costs are chargeable for keys, fobs or security devices which have been lost, damaged or broken. A £15 pr/hr charge for the time spent coordinating the replacement will also be payable.

Eccord is a member of The Property Ombudsman redress scheme (D03886) and the Propertymark Client Money Protection Scheme (C0128880). Visit eccord.com for more details, including Tenant permitted payments and Landlord fees and/or charges.
